content.2: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
content.4: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips;
content.5: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker:
content.7: Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.
content.9: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth
content.10: A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.
content.12: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.
content.13: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
content.15: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both
content.17: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
content.18: A man void of understanding striketh hands,
content.19: He loveth transgression that loveth strife:
content.20: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.
content.27: He that hath knowledge spareth his words:
content.28: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise:
